result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy Allen Fullerton

defendant.name: Fullerton, Troy Allen
defendant.address: W2340 Hanson Rd., Lot #121, Jefferson, WI 53549

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CT156 and 15CM46 called together at 3:20pm [mo]
Defendant Troy Allen Fullerton in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of the Amended Criminal Complaint is admitted; reading is waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1 of the Amended Criminal Complaint of Case 14CT156; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 15CM46

On Count #1 of Case 14CT156, the Court sentences the Defendant: 

--To serve  45 days   in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; this sentence is to be served consecutive to sentence in being, otherwise FORTHWITH
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served,with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
--To pay fine of $600+ costs= $1,694.00 plus blood testing fees to JCSO in the amount of $56.74=$1,750.74,  to be paid in $50 per month installments, commencing on  11/30/15 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 35 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--Revocation of drivers license for 24months
--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 24 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed


22 days credit for time served
recess: 3:34pm

Cases 14CT156 &15CM46 called together at 11:10 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Troy Allen Fullerton in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that both cases remain unresolved and remain in trial posture, have informed Mr. Fullerton that today's hearing would be about bond & future scheduling. Discusses reason for non-appearance last week's hearing, including confusion between cases.
Court reviews case file documents and 3 different notices Mr. Fullerton received for the FSSC date in 15CM46, including personal notice
Court reviews case 14CT156 and that notice was sent for STC in this matter and not returned as undeliverable
ADA Shock notes that there has been prior missed appearance in 15CM46; requests cash bond in both cases

15CM46: Court requires a $1000 CASH bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No operation of a motor vehicle without valid DL

14CT156: Court requires a $1500 CASH bond, with conditions:
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid d.l.
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-Take all controlled substances only as prescribed
Court reinstates the previously scheduled trial dates - ADA Shock indicates that the analyst is currently #2

Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Shock requests that the CM case be set at later date for trial than CT
Court informs parties that if they have witness issues with the CT dates, then the Court will likely reschedule matter for the October 19th & 20th dates.
Recess: 11:33 am 

NEXT: 15CM46 (1) Schedule FSSC 10/13/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 10/19-20/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices 
14CT156 (1) Schedule FSSC 10/8/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 10/12/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Letter from the defendant ref scheduling
Defendant in custody/ Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD

Cases 14CT156 & 15CM46 called together at 10:21 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that he has no explantion for Mr. Fullerton's non-appearance
Court reviews case file, indicates that Mr. Fullerton received notice in person and via mail, which was not returned as undeliverable
ADA Hall requests warrant, presents basis and requests that the jury trials be removed
Court orders issuance of a bench warrant - Body Only in each case and finds the bond to be in default
Court cancels jury trials and informs parties that they may release witnesses for trial
Court recommends that the intake Court consider a significant cash bond given the defendant's failure to appear and the Court having to cancel two jury trials
Recess: 10:25 am
State's Notice of Intent to Admit Statements made by the Defendant

Case called at 9:18am [mo]
Defendant Troy Allen Fullerton in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa indicates that there is no resolution at this time; requests that it be scheduled for Trial.
--no objection from DA Happ

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling of both of Mr. Fullerton's case 15CM46 and 14CT156
-- DA Happ indicates that she does not have analyst availability for the CT case
--The Court schedules FSSC and Trial dates, the State is to contact the Court's JA today to notify of analysts availability
--The Court directs that the CM case is to take precedence over the CT case 

The Court notifies Mr. Fullerton that he has until the FSSC date to enter a plea.
recess: 9:24am

NEXT: On both Cases: 15CM46 & 14CT156 (1) FSSC: 9/15/2015 at 9:00am (2) 9/21 & 9/22/2015 at 8:30am
Defendant in custody/ Duplicate Original Warrant Returned from JCSD

[MK] case called at 1:53pm. 
Defendant Troy Allen Fullerton appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (Attorney De La Rosa is PD-appointed counsel in this case).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Arguments are given on Bond.  During these Mr. Fullerton indicates that he did not receive notice of the missed-hearing; his address should include "Lot #121"

The Court requires a $200  Cash Bond, with the same conditions as previously ordered.
recess 2:00pm. 


NEXT: Status Conference on 8/11/15 at 9:00am.

ADDRESS INFO for Troy Allen Fullerton
Current: W2340 Hanson Rd., Lot #121, Jefferson, WI 53549   (Effective: 07-20-2015)
Prior: W2340 Hanson Rd., Jefferson, WI 53549

ADDRESS INFO for Troy Allen Fullerton
Current: W2340 Hanson Rd., Jefferson, WI 53549   (Effective: 02-11-2015)
Prior: W2340 Hanson Rd., Apt 121, Jefferson, WI 53549

Case called at 9:12am [mo]
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court.  ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, Troy Fullerton does not appear in court. 
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that he has spoke with Mr. Fullerton; further indicates that Mr. Fullerton did not receive notice for todays hearing.
The Court reviews the Court Record.
The Court and Atty. De La Rosa discuss possible difficulty of Mr. Fullerton receiving mail.
The Court and ADA Hall discuss the components of the Criminal Complaint and basis of.
ADA Hall requests a warrant and bond forfeiture
Atty. De La Rosa requests a stayed warrant
The Court issues a bench warrant, body only. 
The Court orders the bond in this case forfeit.
recess: 9:19am
Status conference on June 11, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Case called at 9:14am [mo]
Defendant Troy Allen Fullerton in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that a resolution has not been met although discussion has been made with the State, further he requests a Status.

The Court and Counsel have discussion of another case of Mr. Fullerton regarding the unavailability of an officer witness (14CT156)

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling of this case
NEXT: Status Conference: June 11, 2015 at  8:45am
Status conference on May 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Cases 14CT156 & 15CM46 called together at 10:22 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Troy Allen Fullerton in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CM46: Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $2500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No operation of a motor vehicle without valid DL

14CT156:
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that they are ready to proceed to trial on OWI matter; did discuss with Mr. Fullerton that today would be the deadline for plea 
Court informs Mr. Fullerton that if he changes his mind re: plea

4 strikes each; 1 alternate
Jurors may ask questions & take notes

On Motion to Amend Complaint:
No objection by Defense - Court grants motion
Service of the AMENDED complaint admitted; reading waived

On Notice of Intent to Admit Expert Testimony:
Arguments by Counsel; Court allows what State is requesting, presents parameters of testimony
Court informs parties that It will have assigned prosecutor define testimony on morning of trial
Recess: 10:39 am 

NEXT: 14CT156 - Trial to remain as scheduled - Court's JA to notify parties
14CM56: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 4/22/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 5/8/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
